channel.title: Chee Wei Tan's Homepage
channel.description: Recent content on Chee Wei Tan's Homepage

item.title: Home Content
item.description: Dr. Tan received the M.A and Ph.D. degrees in Electrical Engineering from Princeton University. He was a Senior Fellow of the Institute for Pure and Applied Mathematics (IPAM) for the program on Science at Extreme Scales, and was a Postdoctoral Scholar in the NetLab Group at Caltech. His industrial experience includes consulting for Tencent AI Lab, Qualcomm R&D (QRC), Fraser Research Lab. His research interests are optimization of networks, distributed machine learning, cloud computing and AI.

item.title: Publications
item.description: GitHub Open-source (https://github.com/convexsoft/AITIP) Automated Information Theory Inequality Prover (Software-as-a-Service to Interactively Prove Theorems) Software-as-a-Service Platform freely-available, and is now open-source (Github link in publication below). AITIP: Automated Information Theoretic Inequalities Prover, IEEE Information Theory Society Newsletter, June 2020 Proving and Disproving Information Inequalities: Theory and Scalable Algorithms, IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, September 2020 Journal M. F. Wong, S. Guo, C.-N. Hang, S.-W. Ho, C. W. Tan, Natural Language Generation and Understanding on Big Code for AI-assisted Programming: A Review, Entropy, Special issue on Statistical Machine Learning with High-Dimensional Data Analysis, minor revision, 2023.

item.title: Research
item.description: Postdoctoral Fellow and Ph.D. student openings: (1) Convex optimization and distributed machine learning (2) Artificial Intelligence in Networks (e.g., Large Language Models for wireless and social networks) Candidates are expected to be proficient in mathematics (e.g., linear algebra, convex optimization) and have good software programming experience. Please email at cheewei.tan @ ntu.edu.sg with CV and transcripts. (1) Large Language Model Research: AI-assisted Programming Our research explores the applications of Gen-AI technologies, employing large language models to tackle various challenges.

item.title: Short Introduction
item.description: Research interests are optimization of networks, distributed machine learning, cloud computing and AI.
